DATE.d: Date and time function used to add dates in the default format MM/dd/yyyy

DATEDIF.d: Date and time function used to return the difference between two date values (start date and end date), based on the interval (unit) specified

DATEVALUE.d: Date and time function used to return a serial number of the specified date

DAY.d: Date and time function which returns the day (a number from 1 to 31) of the date given in the numerical format (MM/dd/yyyy by default)

DAYS360.d: Date and time function used to return the number of days between two dates (start-date and end-date) based on a 360-day year using one of the calculation method (US or European)

EDATE.d: Date and time function used to return the serial number of the date which comes the indicated number of months (month-offset) before or after the specified date (start-date)

EOMONTH.d: Date and time function used to return the serial number of the last day of the month that comes the indicated number of months before or after the specified start date

HOUR.d: Date and time function which returns the hour (a number from 0 to 23) of the time value

MINUTE.d: Date and time function which returns the minute (a number from 0 to 59) of the time value

MONTH.d: Date and time function which returns the month (a number from 1 to 12) of the date given in the numerical format (MM/dd/yyyy by default)

NETWORKDAYS.d: Date and time function used to return the number of the work days between two dates (start date and end-date) excluding weekends and dates considered as holidays

SECOND.d: Date and time function which returns the second (a number from 0 to 59) of the time value

TIME.d: Date and time function used to add a particular time in the selected format (hh:mm tt by default)

TIMEVALUE.d: Date and time function used to return the serial number of a time

TODAY.d: Date and time function used to add the current day in the following format MM/dd/yy. This function does not require an argument

WEEKDAY.d: Date and time function used to determine which day of the week the specified date is

WEEKNUM.d: date and time functions. It used to return the number of the week the specified date falls within the year

WORKDAY.d: Date and time function used to return the date which comes the indicated number of days (day-offset) before or after the specified start date excluding weekends and dates considered as holidays

YEAR.d: Date and time function which returns the year (a number from 1900 to 9999) of the date given in the numerical format (MM/dd/yyyy by default)

YEARFRAC.d: Date and time function used to return the fraction of a year represented by the number of whole days from start-date to end-date calculated on the specified basis

BIN2DEC.d: Engineering function used to convert a binary number into a decimal number

BIN2HEX.d: Engineering function used to convert a binary number into a hexadecimal number

BIN2OCT.d: Engineering function used to convert a binary number into an octal number

COMPLEX.d: Engineering function used to convert a real part and an imaginary part into the complex number expressed in a + bi or a + bj form

DEC2BIN.d: Engineering function used to convert a decimal number into a binary number

DEC2HEX.d: Engineering function used to convert a decimal number into a hexadecimal number

DEC2OCT.d: Engineering function used to convert a decimal number into an octal number

DELTA.d: Engineering function used to test if two numbers are equal. The function returns 1 if the numbers are equal and 0 otherwise

ERF.d: Engineering function used to calculate the error function integrated between the specified lower and upper limits

ERFC.d: Engineering function used to calculate the complementary error function integrated between the specified lower limit and infinity

GESTEP.d: Engineering function used to test if a number is greater than a threshold value. The function returns 1 if the number is greater than or equal to the threshold value and 0 otherwise

HEX2BIN.d: Engineering function used to convert a hexadecimal number to a binary number

HEX2DEC.d: Engineering function used to convert a hexadecimal number into a decimal number

HEX2OCT.d: Engineering function used to convert a hexadecimal number to an octal number

IMABS.d: Engineering function used to return the absolute value of a complex number

IMAGINARY.d: Engineering function used to return the imaginary part of the specified complex number

IMARGUMENT.d: Engineering function used to return the argument Theta, an angle expressed in radians

IMCONJUGATE.d: Engineering function used to return the complex conjugate of a complex number

IMCOS.d: Engineering function used to return the cosine of a complex number

IMDIV.d: Engineering function used to return the quotient of two complex numbers expressed in a + bi or a + bj form

IMEXP.d: Engineering function used to return the e constant raised to the to the power specified by a complex number. The e constant is equal to 2,71828182845904

IMLN.d: Engineering function used to return the natural logarithm of a complex number

IMLOG10.d: Engineering function used to return the logarithm of a complex number to a base of 10

IMLOG2.d: Engineering function used to return the logarithm of a complex number to a base of 2

IMPOWER.d: Engineering function used to return the result of a complex number raised to the desired power

IMPRODUCT.d: Engineering function used to return the product of the specified complex numbers

IMREAL.d: Engineering function used to return the real part of the specified complex number

IMSIN.d: Engineering function used to return the sine of a complex number

IMSQRT.d: Engineering function used to return the square root of a complex number

IMSUB.d: Engineering function used to return the difference of two complex numbers expressed in a + bi or a + bj form

IMSUM.d: Engineering function used to return the sum of the specified complex numbers

OCT2BIN.d: Engineering function used to convert an octal number to a binary number

OCT2DEC.d: Engineering function used to convert an octal number to a decimal number

OCT2HEX.d: Engineering function used to convert an octal number to a hexadecimal number

CHAR.d: Text and data function used to return the ASCII character specified by a number

CLEAN.d: Text and data function used to remove all the nonprintable characters from the selected string

CODE.d: Text and data function used to return the ASCII value of the specified character or the first character in a cell

CONCATENATE.d: Text and data function used to combine the data from two or more cells into a single one

DOLLAR.d: Text and data function used to convert a number to text, using a currency format $#.##

EXACT.d: Text and data function used to compare data in two cells. The function returns TRUE if the data are the same, and FALSE if not

FIND.d: Text and data function used to find the specified substring (string-1) within a string (string-2) and is intended for languages that use the single-byte character set (SBCS)

FINDB.d: Text and data function used to find the specified substring (string-1) within a string (string-2) and is intended for languages the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

FIXED.d: Text and data function used to return the text representation of a number rounded to a specified number of decimal places

LEFT.d: Text and data function used to extract the substring from the specified string starting from the left character and is intended for languages that use the single-byte character set (SBCS)

LEFTB.d: Text and data function used to extract the substring from the specified string starting from the left character and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

LEN.d: Text and data function used to analyse the specified string and return the number of characters it contains and is intended for languages that use the single-byte character set (SBCS)

LENB.d: Text and data function used to analyse the specified string and return the number of characters it contains and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

LOWER.d: Text and data function used to convert uppercase letters to lowercase in the selected cell

MID.d: Text and data function used to extract the characters from the specified string starting from any position and is intended for languages that use the single-byte character set (SBCS)

MIDB.d: Text and data function used to extract the characters from the specified string starting from any position and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

PROPER.d: Text and data function used to convert the first character of each word to uppercase and all the remaining characters to lowercase

REPLACE.d: Text and data function used to replace a set of characters, based on the number of characters and the start position you specify, with a new set of characters and is intended for languages that use the single-byte character set (SBCS)

REPLACEB.d: Text and data function used to replace a set of characters, based on the number of characters and the start position you specify, with a new set of characters and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

REPT.d: Text and data function used to repeat the data in the selected cell as many time as you wish

RIGHT.d: Text and data function used to extract a substring from a string starting from the right-most character, based on the specified number of characters and is intended for languages that use the single-byte character set (SBCS)

RIGHTB.d: Text and data function used to extract a substring from a string starting from the right-most character, based on the specified number of characters and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

SEARCH.d: Text and data function used to return the location of the specified substring in a string and is intended for languages that use the single-byte character set (SBCS)

SEARCHB.d: Text and data function used to return the location of the specified substring in a string and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

SUBSTITUTE.d: Text and data function used to replace a set of characters with a new one

T.d: Text and data function used to check whether the value in the cell (or used as argument) is text or not. In case it is not text, the function returns blank result. In case the value/argument is text, the function returns the same text value

TEXT.d: Text and data function used to convert a value to a text in the specified format

TRIM.d: Text and data function used to remove the leading and trailing spaces from a string

UPPER.d: Text and data function used to convert lowercase letters to uppercase in the selected cell

VALUE.d: Text and data function used to convert a text value that represents a number to a number. If the converted text is not a number, the function will return a #VALUE! error

AVEDEV.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the average of the absolute deviations of numbers from their mean

AVERAGE.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the average value

AVERAGEA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data including text and logical values and find the average value. The AVERAGEA function treats text and FALSE as a value of 0 and TRUE as a value of 1

AVERAGEIF.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the average value of all numbers in a range of cells, based on the specified criterion

AVERAGEIFS.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the average value of all numbers in a range of cells, based on the multiple criterions

BINOMDIST.d: Statistical function used to return the individual term binomial distribution probability

CONFIDENCE.d: Statistical function used to return the confidence interval

CORREL.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the correlation coefficient of two range of cells

COUNT.d: Statistical function used to count the number of the selected cells which contain numbers ignoring empty cells or those contaning text

COUNTA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of cells and count the number of cells that are not empty

COUNTBLANK.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of cells and return the number of the empty cells

COUNTIF.d: Statistical function used to count the number of the selected cells based on the specified criterion

COUNTIFS.d: Statistical function used to count the number of the selected cells based on the multiple criterions

COVAR.d: Statistical function used to return the covariance of two ranges of data

CRITBINOM.d: Statistical function used to return the smallest value for which the cumulative binomial distribution is greater than or equal to the specified alpha value

DEVSQ.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and sum the squares of the deviations of numbers from their mean

EXPONDIST.d: Statistical function used to return the exponential distribution

FISHER.d: Statistical function used to return the Fisher transformation of a number

FISHERINV.d: Statistical function used to perform the inverse of Fisher transformation

FORECAST.d: Statistical function used to predict a future value based on existing values provided

FREQUENCY.d: Statistical function used to сalculate how often values occur within the selected range of cells and display the first value of the returned vertical array of numbers

GAMMALN.d: Statistical function used to return the natural logarithm of the gamma function

GEOMEAN.d: Statistical function used to calculate the geometric mean of the argument list

HARMEAN.d: Statistical function used to calculate the harmonic mean of the argument list

HYPGEOMDIST.d: Statistical function used to return the hypergeometric distribution, the probability of a given number of sample successes, given the sample size, population successes, and population size

INTERCEPT.d: Statistical function used to analyze the first array values and second array values to calculate the intersection point

KURT.d: Statistical function used to return the kurtosis of the argument list

LARGE.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of cells and return the nth largest value

LOGINV.d: Statistical function used to return the inverse of the lognormal cumulative distribution function of the given x value with the specified parameters

LOGNORMDIST.d: Statistical function used to analyze logarithmically transformed data and return the lognormal cumulative distribution function of the given x value with the specified parameters

MAX.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the largest number

MAXA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the largest value

MEDIAN.d: Statistical function used to calculate the median of the argument list

MIN.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the smallest number

MINA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the smallest value

MODE.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the most frequently occurring value

NEGBINOMDIST.d: Statistical function used to return the negative binomial distribution

NORMDIST.d: Statistical function used to return the normal distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation

NORMINV.d: Statistical function used to return the inverse of the normal cumulative distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation

NORMSDIST.d: Statistical function used to return the standard normal cumulative distribution function

NORMSINV.d: Statistical function used to return the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution

PEARSON.d: Statistical function used to return the Pearson product moment correlation coefficient

PERCENTILE.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the nth percentile

PERCENTRANK.d: Statistical function used to return the rank of a value in a set of values as a percentage of the set

PERMUT.d: Statistical function used to return the number of permutations for a specified number of items

POISSON.d: Statistical function used to return the Poisson distribution

PROB.d: Statistical function used to return the probability that values in a range are between lower and upper limits

QUARTILE.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the quartile

RSQ.d: Statistical function used to return the square of the Pearson product moment correlation coefficient

SKEW.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the skewness of a distribution of the argument list

SLOPE.d: Statistical function used to return the slope of the linear regression line through data in two arrays

SMALL.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and find the nth smallest value

STANDARDIZE.d: Statistical function used to return a normalized value from a distribution characterized by the specified parameters

STDEV.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the standard deviation of a population based on a set of numbers

STDEVA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the standard deviation of a population based on a set of numbers, text, and logical values (TRUE or FALSE). The STDEVA function treats text and FALSE as a value of 0 and TRUE as a value of 1

STDEVP.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the standard deviation of an entire population

STDEVPA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the range of data and return the standard deviation of an entire population

STEYX.d: Statistical function used to return the standard error of the predicted y-value for each x in the regression line

VAR.d: Statistical function used to analyze the set of values and calculate the sample variance

VARA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the set of values and calculate the sample variance

VARP.d: Statistical function used to analyze the set of values and calculate the variance of an entire population

VARPA.d: Statistical function used to analyze the set of values and return the variance of an entire population

ACCRINT.a: ( issue , first-interest , settlement , rate , [ par ] , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
ACCRINT.d: Financial function used to calculate the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest

ACCRINTM.d: Financial function used to calculate the accrued interest for a security that pays interest at maturity

AMORDEGRC.a: ( cost , date-purchased , first-period , salvage , period , rate [ , [ basis ] ] )
AMORDEGRC.d: Financial function used to calculate the depreciation of an asset for each accounting period using a degressive depreciation method

AMORLINC.a: ( cost , date-purchased , first-period , salvage , period , rate [ , [ basis ] ] )
AMORLINC.d: Financial function used to calculate the depreciation of an asset for each accounting period using a linear depreciation method

COUPDAYBS.d: Financial function used to calculate the number of days from the beginning of the coupon period to the settlement date

COUPDAYS.d: Financial function used to calculate the number of days in the coupon period that contains the settlement date

COUPDAYSNC.d: Financial function used to calculate the number of days from the settlement date to the next coupon payment

COUPNCD.d: Financial function used to calculate the next coupon date after the settlement date

COUPNUM.d: Financial function used to calculate the number of coupons between the settlement date and the maturity date

COUPPCD.d: Financial function used to calculate the previous coupon date before the settlement date

CUMIPMT.a: ( rate , nper , pv , start-period , end-period , type )
CUMIPMT.d: Financial function used to calculate the cumulative interest paid on an investment between two periods based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

CUMPRINC.a: ( rate , nper , pv , start-period , end-period , type )
CUMPRINC.d: Financial function used to calculate the cumulative principal paid on an investment between two periods based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

DB.d: Financial function used to calculate the depreciation of an asset for a specified accounting period using the fixed-declining balance method

DDB.d: Financial function used to calculate the depreciation of an asset for a specified accounting period using the double-declining balance method

DISC.d: Financial function used to calculate the discount rate for a security

DOLLARDE.d: Financial function used to convert a dollar price represented as a fraction into a dollar price represented as a decimal number

DOLLARFR.d: Financial function used to convert a dollar price represented as a decimal number into a dollar price represented as a fraction

DURATION.a: ( settlement , maturity , coupon , yld , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
DURATION.d: Financial function used to calculate the Macaulay duration of a security with an assumed par value of $100

EFFECT.d: Financial function used to calculate the effective annual interest rate for a security based on a specified nominal annual interest rate and the number of compounding periods per year

FV.d: Financial function used to calculate the future value of an investment based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

FVSCHEDULE.d: Financial function used to calculate the future value of an investment based on a series of changeable interest rates

INTRATE.d: Financial function used to calculate the interest rate for a fully invested security that pays interest only at maturity

IPMT.a: ( rate , per , nper , pv [ , [ fv ] [ , [ type ] ] ] )
IPMT.d: Financial function used to calculate the interest payment for an investment based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

IRR.d: Financial function used to calculate the internal rate of return for a series of periodic cash flows

ISPMT.d: Financial function used to calculate the interest payment for a specified period of an investment based on a constant payment schedule

MDURATION.a: ( settlement , maturity , coupon , yld , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
MDURATION.d: Financial function used to calculate the modified Macaulay duration of a security with an assumed par value of $100

MIRR.d: Financial function used to calculate the modified internal rate of return for a series of periodic cash flows

NOMINAL.d: Financial function used to calculate the nominal annual interest rate for a security based on a specified effective annual interest rate and the number of compounding periods per year

NPER.d: Financial function used to calculate the number of periods for an investment based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

NPV.d: Financial function used to calculate the net present value of an investment based on a specified discount rate

ODDFPRICE.a: ( settlement , maturity , issue , first-coupon , rate , yld , redemption , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
ODDFPRICE.d: Financial function used to calculate the price per $100 par value for a security that pays periodic interest but has an odd first period (it is shorter or longer than other periods)

ODDFYIELD.a: ( settlement , maturity , issue , first-coupon , rate , pr , redemption , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
ODDFYIELD.d: Financial function used to calculate the yield of a security that pays periodic interest but has an odd first period (it is shorter or longer than other periods)

ODDLPRICE.a: ( settlement , maturity , last-interest , rate , yld , redemption , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
ODDLPRICE.d: Financial function used to calculate the price per $100 par value for a security that pays periodic interest but has an odd last period (it is shorter or longer than other periods)

ODDLYIELD.a: ( settlement , maturity , last-interest , rate , pr , redemption , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
ODDLYIELD.d: Financial function used to calculate the yield of a security that pays periodic interest but has an odd last period (it is shorter or longer than other periods)

PMT.d: Financial function used to calculate the payment amount for a loan based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

PPMT.a: ( rate , per , nper , pv [ , [ fv ] [ , [ type ] ] ] )
PPMT.d: Financial function used to calculate the principal payment for an investment based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

PRICE.a: ( settlement , maturity , rate , yld , redemption , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
PRICE.d: Financial function used to calculate the price per $100 par value for a security that pays periodic interest

PRICEDISC.d: Financial function used to calculate the price per $100 par value for a discounted security

PRICEMAT.a: ( settlement , maturity , issue , rate , yld [ , [ basis ] ] )
PRICEMAT.d: Financial function used to calculate the price per $100 par value for a security that pays interest at maturity

PV.d: Financial function used to calculate the present value of an investment based on a specified interest rate and a constant payment schedule

RATE.a: ( nper , pmt , pv  [ , [ [ fv ] [ , [ [ type ] [ , [ guess ] ] ] ] ] ] )
RATE.d: Financial function used to calculate the interest rate for an investment based on a constant payment schedule

RECEIVED.d: Financial function used to calculate the amount received at maturity for a fully invested security

SLN.d: Financial function used to calculate the depreciation of an asset for one accounting period using the straight-line depreciation method

SYD.d: Financial function used to calculate the depreciation of an asset for a specified accounting period using the sum of the years' digits method

TBILLEQ.d: Financial function used to calculate the bond-equivalent yield of a Treasury bill

TBILLPRICE.d: Financial function used to calculate the price per $100 par value for a Treasury bill

TBILLYIELD.d: Financial function used to calculate the yield of a Treasury bill

VDB.a: ( cost , salvage , life , start-period , end-period [ , [ [ factor ] [ , [ no-switch-flag ] ] ] ] ] )
VDB.d: Financial function used to calculate the depreciation of an asset for a specified or partial accounting period using the variable declining balance method

XIRR.d: Financial function used to calculate the internal rate of return for a series of irregular cash flows

XNPV.d: Financial function used to calculate the net present value for an investment based on a specified interest rate and a schedule of irregular payments

YIELD.a: ( settlement , maturity , rate , pr , redemption , frequency [ , [ basis ] ] )
YIELD.d: Financial function used to calculate the yield of a security that pays periodic interest

YIELDDISC.d: Financial function used to calculate the annual yield of a discounted security

YIELDMAT.a: ( settlement , maturity , issue , rate , pr [ , [ basis ] ] )
YIELDMAT.d: Financial function used to calculate the annual yield of a security that pays interest at maturity

ABS.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the absolute value of a number

ACOS.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the arccosine of a number

ACOSH.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number

ASIN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the arcsine of a number

ASINH.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the inverse hyperbolic sine of a number

ATAN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the arctangent of a number

ATAN2.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the arctangent of x and y coordinates

ATANH.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number

CEILING.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number up to the nearest multiple of significance

COMBIN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the number of combinations for a specified number of items

COS.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the cosine of an angle

COSH.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the hyperbolic cosine of a number

DEGREES.d: Math and trigonometry function used to convert radians into degrees

EVEN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number up to the nearest even integer

EXP.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the e constant raised to the desired power. The e constant is equal to 2,71828182845904

FACT.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the factorial of a number

FACTDOUBLE.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the double factorial of a number

FLOOR.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number down to the nearest multiple of significance

GCD.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the greatest common divisor of two or more numbers

INT.d: Math and trigonometry function used to analyze and return the integer part of the specified number

LCM.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the lowest common multiple of one or more numbers

LN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the natural logarithm of a number

LOG.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the logarithm of a number to a specified base

LOG10.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the logarithm of a number to a base of 10

MDETERM.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the matrix determinant of an array

MINVERSE.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the inverse matrix for a given matrix and display the first value of the returned array of numbers

MMULT.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the matrix product of two arrays and display the first value of the returned array of numbers

MOD.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the remainder after the division of a number by the specified divisor

MROUND.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number to the desired multiple

MULTINOMIAL.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the ratio of the factorial of a sum of numbers to the product of factorials

ODD.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number up to the nearest odd integer

PI.d: math and trigonometry functions. The function returns the mathematical constant pi, equal to 3.14159265358979. It does not require any argument

POWER.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the result of a number raised to the desired power

PRODUCT.d: Math and trigonometry function used to multiply all the numbers in the selected range of cells and return the product

QUOTIENT.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the integer portion of a division

RADIANS.d: Math and trigonometry function used to convert degrees into radians

RAND.d: math and trigonometry functions. The function returns a random number greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1. It does not require any argument

RANDBETWEEN.d: math and trigonometry functions. The function returns a random number greater than or equal to lower-bound and less than or equal to upper-bound

ROMAN.d: math and trigonometry functions. The function is used to convert a number to a roman numeral

ROUND.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number to the desired number of digits

ROUNDDOWN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number down to the desired number of digits

ROUNDUP.d: Math and trigonometry function used to round the number up to the desired number of digits

SERIESSUM.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the sum of a power series

SIGN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the sign of a number. If the number is positive, the function returns 1. If the number is negative, the function returns -1. If the number is 0, the function returns 0

SIN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the sine of an angle

SINH.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the hyperbolic sine of a number

SQRT.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the square root of a number

SQRTPI.d: one of the Math and trigonometry function used to return the square root of the pi constant (3.14159265358979) multiplied by the specified number

SUBTOTAL.d: Returns a subtotal in a list or database

SUM.d: Math and trigonometry function used to add all the numbers in the selected range of cells and return the result

SUMIF.d: Math and trigonometry function used to add all the numbers in the selected range of cells based on the specified criterion and return the result

SUMIFS.d: Math and trigonometry function used to add all the numbers in the selected range of cells based on multiple criteria and return the result

SUMPRODUCT.d: Math and trigonometry function used to multiply the values in the selected ranges of cells or arrays and return the sum of the products

SUMSQ.d: Math and trigonometry function used to add the squares of numbers and return the result

SUMX2MY2.d: Math and trigonometry function used to sum the difference of squares between two arrays

SUMX2PY2.d: Math and trigonometry function used to sum the squares of numbers in the selected arrays and return the sum of the results

SUMXMY2.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the sum of the squares of the differences between corresponding items in the arrays

TAN.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the tangent of an angle

TANH.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return the hyperbolic tangent of a number

TRUNC.d: Math and trigonometry function used to return a number truncated to a specified number of digits

ADDRESS.d: Lookup and reference function used to return a text representation of a cell address

CHOOSE.d: Lookup and reference function used to return a value from a list of values based on a specified index (position)

COLUMN.d: Lookup and reference function used to return the column number of a cell

COLUMNS.d: Lookup and reference function used to return the number of columns in a cell reference

HLOOKUP.d: Lookup and reference function used to perform the horizontal search for a value in the top row of a table or an array and return the value in the same column based on a specified row index number

INDEX.a: ( array , [ row-number ] [ , [ column-number ] ] ) INDEX( reference , [ row-number ] [ , [ column-number ] [ , [ area-number ] ] ] )
INDEX.d: Lookup and reference function used to return a value within a range of cells on the base of a specified row and column number. The INDEX function has two forms

INDIRECT.d: Lookup and reference function used to return the reference to a cell based on its string representation

LOOKUP.d: Lookup and reference function used to return a value from a selected range (row or column containing the data in ascending order)

MATCH.d: Lookup and reference function used to return a relative position of a specified item in a range of cells

OFFSET.d: Lookup and reference function used to return a reference to a cell displaced from the specified cell (or the upper-left cell in the range of cells) to a certain number of rows and columns

ROW.d: Lookup and reference function used to return the row number of a cell reference

ROWS.d: Lookup and reference function used to return the number of rows in a cell references

TRANSPOSE.d: Lookup and reference function used to return the first element of an array

VLOOKUP.d: Lookup and reference function used to perform the vertical search for a value in the left-most column of a table or an array and return the value in the same row based on a specified column index number

ERROR.TYPE.d: Information function used to return the numeric representation of one of the existing errors

ISBLANK.d: Information function used to check if the cell is empty or not. If the cell does not contain any value, the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

ISERR.d: Information function used to check for an error value. If the cell contains an error value (except #N/A), the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

ISERROR.d: Information function used to check for an error value. If the cell contains one of the error values: #N/A, #VALUE!, #REF!, #DIV/0!, #NUM!, #NAME? or #NULL, the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

ISEVEN.d: Information function used to check for an even value. If the cell contains an even value, the function returns TRUE. If the value is odd, it returns FALSE

ISLOGICAL.d: Information function used to check for a logical value (TRUE or FALSE). If the cell contains a logical value, the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

ISNA.d: Information function used to check for a #N/A error. If the cell contains a #N/A error value, the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

ISNONTEXT.d: Information function used to check for a value that is not a text. If the cell does not contain a text value, the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

ISNUMBER.d: Information function used to check for a numeric value. If the cell contains a numeric value, the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

ISODD.d: Information function used to check for an odd value. If the cell contains an odd value, the function returns TRUE. If the value is even, it returns FALSE

ISREF.d: Information function used to verify if the value is a valid cell reference

ISTEXT.d: Information function used to check for a text value. If the cell contains a text value, the function returns TRUE, otherwise the function returns FALSE

N.d: Information function used to convert a value to a number

NA.d: Information function used to return the #N/A error value. This function does not require an argument

TYPE.d: Information function used to determine the type of the resulting or displayed value

AND.d: Logical function used to check if the logical value you enter is TRUE or FALSE. The function returns TRUE if all the arguments are TRUE

FALSE.d: logical functions. The function returns FALSE and does not require any argument

IF.d: Logical function used to check the logical expression and return one value if it is TRUE, or another if it is FALSE

IFERROR.d: Logical function used to check if there is an error in the formula in the first argument. The function returns the result of the formula if there is no error, or the value_if_error if there is one

NOT.d: Logical function used to check if the logical value you enter is TRUE or FALSE. The function returns TRUE if the argument is FALSE and FALSE if the argument is TRUE

OR.d: Logical function used to check if the logical value you enter is TRUE or FALSE. The function returns FALSE if all the arguments are FALSE

TRUE.d: logical functions which returns TRUE and does not require any argument
